The Avatar component should: 1. Be placed in `packages/components/avatar/` directory 2. Follow the same file structure as other components (like the button component) 3. Include the following files: - `src/avatar.tsx` - Main component implementation - `src/use-avatar.ts` - Custom hook for avatar logic (if needed) - `src/index.ts` - Export file - `package.json` - Package configuration 4. Implement basic avatar functionality such as: - Display user profile image or initials - Support different sizes (small, medium, large) - Fallback to initials when image is not available - Optional status indicator (online/offline) - Support rounded avatar 5. Use TypeScript for type safety 6. Follow the existing coding patterns and conventions used in other components 7. Include proper prop types and default values 8. Ensure the component is properly exported and can be imported by other packages Please analyze the existing button component structure first to understand the patterns and conventions used in this codebase before creating the Avatar component.","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Create a new Avatar component in the packages directory following the existing component structure and patterns used in this codebase. Used to generate initials when image is not available.\n */\n name?: string\n /**\n * Custom initials to display instead of generated ones.\n */\n initials?: string\n /**\n * Whether to show a status indicator.\n * @default false\n */\n showStatus?: boolean\n /**\n * The status of the user.\n * @default \"online\"\n */\n status?: AvatarStatusVariantProps['status']\n /**\n * Custom icon to display instead of image or initials.\n */\n icon?: React.ReactNode\n /**\n * Fallback component to render when image fails to load.\n */\n fallback?: React.ReactNode\n /**\n * Callback fired when the image fails to load.\n */\n onError?: () => void\n /**\n * Whether the avatar is clickable.\n * @default false\n */\n isClickable?: boolean\n /**\n * Custom styles for the avatar\n */\n customStyles?: string\n }\n\nexport function useAvatar(props: UseAvatarProps) {\n const {\n ref,\n as,\n src,\n alt,\n name,\n initials: customInitials,\n showStatus = false,\n status = 'online',\n icon,\n fallback,\n onError,\n isClickable = false,\n color = 'primary',\n size = 'md',\n radius = 'full',\n isBordered = true,\n isDisabled = false,\n className,\n customStyles,\n onClick,\n ...otherProps\n } = props\n\n const domRef = React.useRef(null)\n const [imageError, setImageError] = React.useState(false)\n const [imageLoaded, setImageLoaded] = React.useState(false)\n\n React.useImperativeHandle(ref, () => domRef.current)\n\n // Generate initials from name\n const generatedInitials = React.useMemo(() => {\n if (customInitials) return customInitials\n if (!name) return ''\n \n return name\n .split(' ')\n .slice(0, 2)\n .map(word => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase())\n .join('')\n }, [name, customInitials])\n\n // Handle image error\n const handleImageError = React.useCallback(() => {\n setImageError(true)\n onError?.()\n }, [onError])\n\n // Handle image load\n const handleImageLoad = React.useCallback(() => {\n setImageLoaded(true)\n setImageError(false)\n }, [])\n\n // Reset image state when src changes\n React.useEffect(() => {\n if (src) {\n setImageError(false)\n setImageLoaded(false)\n }\n }, [src])\n\n // Avatar styles\n const avatarStyles = React.useMemo(\n () =>\n avatar({\n color,\n size,\n radius,\n isBordered,\n isDisabled,\n className: [customStyles, className].filter(Boolean).join(' ')\n }),\n [color, size, radius, isBordered, isDisabled, customStyles, className]\n )\n\n // Status indicator styles\n const statusStyles = React.useMemo(\n () =>\n avatarStatus({\n size,\n status\n }),\n [size, status]\n )\n\n // Handle click\n const handleClick = React.useCallback((e: React.MouseEvent) => {\n if (isDisabled || !isClickable) return\n onClick?.(e)\n }, [isDisabled, isClickable, onClick])\n\n // Determine what to render inside avatar\n const renderContent = () => {\n // If there's a custom icon, render it\n if (icon) {\n return {icon}\n }\n\n // If image is available and loaded successfully, render it\n if (src && !imageError) {\n return (\n \n )\n }\n\n // If there's a custom fallback, render it\n if (fallback) {\n return {fallback}\n }\n\n // Render initials or default user icon\n if React from 'react'\nimport { render, screen, fireEvent } from '@testing-library/react'\nimport { Avatar } from '../src'\n\ndescribe('Avatar', () => {\n it('should render correctly', () => {\n render()\n expect(screen.getByText('JD')).toBeInTheDocument()\n })\n\n it('should display custom initials', () => {\n render()\n expect(screen.getByText('AB')).toBeInTheDocument()\n })\n\n it('should render image when src is provided', () => {\n render()\n const img = screen.getByRole('img')\n expect(img).toHaveAttribute('src', 'test.jpg')\n expect(img).toHaveAttribute('alt', 'Test Avatar')\n })\n\n it('should show status indicator when showStatus is true', () => {\n render()\n const status = screen.getByLabelText('Status: online')\n expect(status).toBeInTheDocument()\n })\n\n it('should be clickable when isClickable is true', () => {\n const handleClick = jest.fn()\n render()\n \n const avatar = screen.getByRole('button')\n fireEvent.click(avatar)\n \n expect(handleClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1)\n })\n\n it('should not be clickable when disabled', () => {\n const handleClick = jest.fn()\n render()\n \n const avatar = screen.getByRole('button')\n fireEvent.click(avatar)\n \n expect(handleClick).not.toHaveBeenCalled()\n })\n\n it('should render custom icon', () => {\n const icon = Icon\n render()\n expect(screen.getByTestId('custom-icon')).toBeInTheDocument()\n })\n\n it('should render fallback when provided', () => {\n const fallback = Fallback\n render()\n expect(screen.getByTestId('fallback')).toBeInTheDocument()\n })\n\n it('should generate initials from name', () => {\n render()\n expect(screen.getByText('JM')).toBeInTheDocument()\n })\n\n it('should render default user icon when no name or initials', () => {\n render()\n const svg = screen.getByRole('img', { hidden: true })\n expect(svg).toBeInTheDocument()\n })\n\n it('should apply custom styles', () => {\n render()\n const avatar = screen.getByText('JD').parentElement\n expect(avatar).toHaveClass('custom-class')\n })\n})"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":""},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"File "import React from 'react'\nimport { renderHook, act } from '@testing-library/react'\nimport { useAvatar } from '../src'\n\ndescribe('useAvatar', () => {\n it('should return correct default values', () => {\n const { result } = renderHook(() => useAvatar({}))\n \n expect(result.current.Component).toBe('div')\n expect(result.current.showStatus).toBe(false)\n expect(result.current.isClickable).toBe(false)\n })\n\n it('should generate initials from name', () => {\n const { result } = renderHook(() => useAvatar({ name: 'John Doe' }))\n \n // Test the renderContent function\n const content = result.current.renderContent()\n expect(content.props.children.props.children).toBe('JD')\n })\n\n it('should use custom initials when provided', () => {\n const { result } = renderHook(() => useAvatar({ name: 'John Doe', initials: 'AB' }))\n \n const content = result.current.renderContent()\n expect(content.props.children.props.children).toBe('AB')\n })\n\n it('should handle click when clickable', () => {\n const onClick = jest.fn()\n const { result } = renderHook(() => useAvatar({ isClickable: true, onClick }))\n \n const mockEvent = { preventDefault: jest.fn() } as any\n act(() => {\n result.current.handleClick(mockEvent)\n })\n \n expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledWith(mockEvent)\n })\n\n it('should not handle click when disabled', () => {\n const onClick = jest.fn()\n const { result } = renderHook(() => useAvatar({ \n isClickable: true, \n isDisabled: true, \n onClick \n }))\n \n const mockEvent = { preventDefault: jest.fn() } as any\n act(() => {\n result.current.handleClick(mockEvent)\n })\n \n expect(onClick).not.toHaveBeenCalled()\n })\n\n it('should return correct styles', () => {\n const { result } = renderHook(() => useAvatar({ \n color: 'primary',\n size: 'md',\n radius: 'full'\n }))\n \n expect(result.current.avatarStyles).toContain('text-blue-800')\n expect(result.current.avatarStyles).toContain('w-10')\n expect(result.current.avatarStyles).toContain('rounded-full')\n })\n\n it('should handle status styles', () => {\n const { result } = renderHook(() => useAvatar({ \n showStatus: true,\n status: 'online',\n size: 'md'\n }))\n \n expect(result.current.statusStyles).toContain('bg-green-500')\n expect(result.current.statusStyles).toContain('w-3')\n })\n})"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":""},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"File IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "packages/components/avatar/README.md", "file_content": "# @faiz-ui/avatar\n\nA versatile Avatar component for displaying user profile images, initials, or icons with a hand-drawn aesthetic.\n\n## Installation\n\n```sh\npnpm add @faiz-ui/avatar\n# or\nnpm i @faiz-ui/avatar\n```\n\n## Usage\n\n```tsx\nimport { Avatar } from '@faiz-ui/avatar'\n\n// Basic usage with name (shows initials)\n\n\n// With image\n\n\n// With status indicator\n\n\n// Custom initials\n\n\n// With custom icon\n} \n color=\"info\" \n/>\n\n// Clickable avatar\n console.log('Avatar clicked!')} \n/>\n```\n\n## API\n\n### Avatar Props\n\n| Prop | Type | Default | Description |\n|------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `name` | `string` | - | The name of the user. Used to generate initials when image is not available |\n| `src` | `string` | - | The source URL of the avatar image |\n| `alt` | `string` | - | The alt text for the avatar image |\n| `initials` | `string` | - | Custom initials to display instead of generated ones |\n| `color` | `'primary' \\| 'secondary' \\| 'success' \\| 'warning' \\| 'danger' \\| 'info'` | `'primary'` | The color theme of the avatar |\n| `size` | `'xs' \\| 'sm' \\| 'md' \\| 'lg' \\| 'xl'` | `'md'` | The size of the avatar |\n| `radius` | `'none' \\| 'sm' \\| 'md' \\| 'lg' \\| 'xl' \\| 'full'` | `'full'` | The border radius of the avatar |\n| `showStatus` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether to show a status indicator |\n| `status` | `'online' \\| 'offline' \\| 'away' \\| 'busy'` | `'online'` | The status of the user |\n| `icon` | `ReactNode` | - | Custom icon to display instead of image or initials |\n| `fallback` | `ReactNode` | - | Fallback component to render when image fails to load |\n| `isBordered` | `boolean` | `true` | Whether to show the border |\n| `isDisabled` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether the avatar is disabled |\n| `isClickable` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether the avatar is clickable |\n| `onError` | `() => void` | - | Callback fired when the image fails to load |\n| `onClick` | `(event: MouseEvent) => void` | - | Callback fired when the avatar is clicked |\n| `customStyles` | `string` | - | Custom CSS classes to apply |\n\n## Features\n\n- **Image Support**: Display user profile images with automatic fallback to initials\n- **Initials Generation**: Automatically generates initials from user names\n- **Status Indicators**: Show online/offline/away/busy status with colored dots\n- **Multiple Sizes**: Support for xs, sm, md, lg, xl sizes\n- **Color Variants**: Six color themes following the design system\n- **Clickable**: Optional click handling with proper accessibility\n- **Accessibility**: Proper ARIA labels and keyboard navigation support\n- **Hand-drawn Style**: Follows the faiz-ui design aesthetic with sketchy borders and shadows\n- **TypeScript**: Full TypeScript support with proper type definitions\n- **Customizable**: Support for custom icons, fallbacks, and styling\n\n## Examples\n\n### Size Variants\n```tsx\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n
\n```\n\n### Color Variants\n```tsx\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n```\n\n### Status Indicators\n```tsx\n
\n \n \n \n \n
\n```"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a README file for the avatar component: "},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"File saved. Now let me create a summary of what has been accomplished: ## Summary I have successfully created a new Avatar component for the faiz-ui component library following all the existing patterns and conventions. Here's what was implemented: ### ✅ **Files Created:** 1. **`packages/components/avatar/src/avatar.tsx`** - Main component implementation 2. **`packages/components/avatar/src/use-avatar.ts`** - Custom hook for avatar logic 3. **`packages/components/avatar/src/index.ts`** - Export file 4. **`packages/components/avatar/package.json`** - Package configuration 5. **`packages/components/avatar/tsconfig.json`** - TypeScript configuration 6. **`packages/components/avatar/tsup.config.ts`** - Build configuration 7. **`packages/components/avatar/stories/avatar.stories.tsx`** - Storybook stories 8. **`packages/components/avatar/__tests__/avatar.test.tsx`** - Component tests 9. **`packages/components/avatar/__tests__/use-avatar.test.tsx`** - Hook tests 10. **`packages/components/avatar/README.md`** - Documentation 11. **`packages/core/theme/src/components/avatar.ts`** - Theme configuration ### ✅ **Files Modified:** 1. **`packages/core/theme/src/components/index.ts`** - Added avatar export ### ✅ **Features Implemented:** - **Image Support**: Display user profile images with automatic fallback to initials - **Initials Generation**: Automatically generates initials from user names (e.g., "John Doe" → "JD") - **Status Indicators**: Show online/offline/away/busy status with colored dots - **Multiple Sizes**: Support for xs, sm, md, lg, xl sizes - **Color Variants**: Six color themes (primary, secondary, success, warning, danger, info) - **Clickable**: Optional click handling with proper accessibility - **Custom Icons**: Support for custom icons instead of initials - **Fallback Support**: Custom fallback components when image fails to load - **Hand-drawn Style**: Follows the faiz-ui design aesthetic with sketchy borders and shadows - **TypeScript**: Full TypeScript support with proper type definitions - **Accessibility**: Proper ARIA labels and keyboard navigation support - **Customizable**: Support for custom styling and border options ### ✅ **Component Usage Examples:** ```typescript import Avatar from "./avatar"; // export types export type { AvatarProps } from "./avatar"; // export hooks export { useAvatar } from "./use-avatar"; // export component export { Avatar }; ``` **Basic Usage:** ```tsx import { Avatar } from '@faiz-ui/avatar' // With name (shows initials) // With image // With status indicator // Clickable avatar console.log('Avatar clicked!')} /> ``` ### ✅ **Testing:** - ✅ All 18 tests pass - ✅ TypeScript compilation successful - ✅ Build process successful - ✅ Theme integration working ### ✅ **Integration:** The Avatar component is now fully integrated into the faiz-ui component library and can be: - Imported and used in other packages - Built and distributed - Tested with Jest - Documented with Storybook - Styled with the existing theme system The component follows all the established patterns in the codebase including: - Separation of logic (hook) and view (component) - Proper TypeScript typing - Theme integration with tailwind-variants - Consistent file structure and naming - Comprehensive testing - Storybook documentation The Avatar component is now ready for use and can be imported as `@faiz-ui/avatar` once published!"},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":"Perfect! Added avatar export ### ✅ **Features Implemented:** - **Image Support**: Display user profile images with automatic fallback to initials - **Initials Generation**: Automatically generates initials from user names (e.g., "John Doe" → "JD") - **Status Indicators**: Show online/offline/away/busy status with colored dots - **Multiple Sizes**: Support for xs, sm, md, lg, xl sizes - **Color Variants**: Six color themes (primary, secondary, success, warning, danger, info) - **Clickable**: Optional click handling with proper accessibility - **Custom Icons**: Support for custom icons instead of initials - **Fallback Support**: Custom fallback components when image fails to load - **Hand-drawn Style**: Follows the faiz-ui design aesthetic with sketchy borders and shadows - **TypeScript**: Full TypeScript support with proper type definitions - **Accessibility**: Proper ARIA labels and keyboard navigation support - **Customizable**: Support for custom styling and border options ### ✅ **Component Usage Examples:** ````typescript path=packages/components/avatar/src/index.ts mode=EXCERPT import Avatar from "./avatar"; // export types export type { AvatarProps } from "./avatar"; // export hooks export { useAvatar } from "./use-avatar"; // export component export { Avatar }; ```` **Basic Usage:** ```tsx import { Avatar } from '@faiz-ui/avatar' // With name (shows initials) // With image // With status indicator // Clickable avatar console.log('Avatar clicked!')} /> ``` ### ✅ **Testing:** - ✅ All 18 tests pass - ✅ TypeScript compilation successful - ✅ Build process successful - ✅ Theme integration working ### ✅ **Integration:** The Avatar component is now fully integrated into the faiz-ui component library and can be: - Imported and used in other packages - Built and distributed - Tested with Jest - Documented with Storybook - Styled with the existing theme system The component follows all the established patterns in the codebase including: - Separation of logic (hook) and view (component) - Proper TypeScript typing - Theme integration with tailwind-variants - Consistent file structure and naming - Comprehensive testing - Storybook documentation The Avatar component is now ready for use and can be imported as `@faiz-ui/avatar` once published! All tests are passing. Let me create a summary of the fixes I've implemented: ## ✅ **Avatar Status Indicator Styling Issues - FIXED** I have successfully resolved all the styling issues with the Avatar component's status indicators. Here's a comprehensive summary of the fixes: ### ** Issues Fixed:** 1. **Status indicators were being clipped by avatar overflow** ✅ 2. **Improper positioning across different avatar sizes** ✅ 3. **Z-index layering conflicts** ✅ 4. **Poor visibility with different avatar variants** ✅ 5. **Status dots not fully visible or cut off** ✅ ### ** Key Changes Made:** #### **1. Avatar Theme Configuration (`packages/core/theme/src/components/avatar.ts`)** ```typescript export const avatar = tv({ base: [ 'relative inline-flex items-center justify-center', // Removed overflow-hidden from main container // Added content wrapper styling for proper overflow handling '[&>*:not(:last-child)]:overflow-hidden [&>*:not(:last-child)]:rounded-[inherit]' ], ``` #### **2. Enhanced Status Indicator Positioning** ```typescript export const avatarStatus = tv({ base: [ 'absolute z-20', 'border-2 border-white dark:border-gray-900', 'rounded-full', 'ring-1 ring-black/10 dark:ring-white/10', 'shadow-sm' // Added shadow for better visibility ], variants: { size: { xs: 'w-2 h-2 -bottom-0.5 -right-0.5 border-[1px]', sm: 'w-2.5 h-2.5 -bottom-0.5 -right-0.5 border-[1.5px]', md: 'w-3 h-3 -bottom-0.5 -right-0.5', lg: 'w-3.5 h-3.5 -bottom-1 -right-1', xl: 'w-4 h-4 -bottom-1 -right-1' } } }) ``` #### **3. Avatar Component Structure Update** ```typescript return ( {/* Content wrapper with overflow hidden */}
{renderContent()} {children}
{/* Status indicator positioned outside content area */} {showStatus && ( )} ) ``` ### **✨ Improvements Delivered:** 1. **✅ Fully Visible Status Dots**: Status indicators are now positioned outside the content area and are never clipped 2. **✅ Size-Responsive Positioning**: Each avatar size has optimized status indicator positioning 3. **✅ Enhanced Contrast**: Added white/dark borders and subtle shadows for better visibility 4. **✅ Proper Z-Index Layering**: Status indicators have `z-20` to appear above all other elements 5. **✅ Universal Compatibility**: Works with all avatar variants (bordered/borderless, all colors, all sizes) 6. **✅ Accessibility**: Proper ARIA labels maintained ### ** Testing:** - **✅ 21/21 tests passing** (including 3 new comprehensive status indicator tests) - **✅ TypeScript compilation successful** - **✅ Build process successful** - **✅ All avatar sizes tested** (xs, sm, md, lg, xl) - **✅ All status types tested** (online, offline, away, busy) - **✅ All avatar variants tested** (colors, borders, images) ### ** Documentation Updated:** - **✅ README.md** - Enhanced feature descriptions and examples - **✅ Storybook stories** - Added comprehensive status indicator examples - **✅ Example file** - Showcases all status indicator scenarios ### ** Visual Results:** The status indicators now appear as: - **Complete circular dots** in the bottom-right corner - **Fully visible** against any avatar background - **Properly sized** for each avatar size - **High contrast** with white borders and subtle shadows - **Consistent positioning** across all variants The Avatar component now provides a professional, polished user experience with status indicators that are always clearly visible and properly positioned, regardless of the avatar configuration used. Avatar Theme Configuration (`packages/core/theme/src/components/avatar.ts`)** ````typescript path=packages/core/theme/src/components/avatar.ts mode=EXCERPT export const avatar = tv({ base: [ 'relative inline-flex items-center justify-center', // Removed overflow-hidden from main container // Added content wrapper styling for proper overflow handling '[&>*:not(:last-child)]:overflow-hidden [&>*:not(:last-child)]:rounded-[inherit]' ], ```` #### **2. Avatar Component Structure Update** ````typescript path=packages/components/avatar/src/avatar.tsx mode=EXCERPT return ( {/* Content wrapper with overflow hidden */}
{renderContent()} {children}
{/* Status indicator positioned outside content area */} {showStatus && ( )} ) ```` ### **✨ Improvements Delivered:** 1. **✅ Fully Visible Status Dots**: Status indicators are now positioned outside the content area and are never clipped 2. **✅ Size-Responsive Positioning**: Each avatar size has optimized status indicator positioning 3. **✅ Enhanced Contrast**: Added white/dark borders and subtle shadows for better visibility 4. **✅ Proper Z-Index Layering**: Status indicators have `z-20` to appear above all other elements 5. **✅ Universal Compatibility**: Works with all avatar variants (bordered/borderless, all colors, all sizes) 6. **✅ Accessibility**: Proper ARIA labels maintained ### ** Testing:** - **✅ 21/21 tests passing** (including 3 new comprehensive status indicator tests) - **✅ TypeScript compilation successful** - **✅ Build process successful** - **✅ All avatar sizes tested** (xs, sm, md, lg, xl) - **✅ All status types tested** (online, offline, away, busy) - **✅ All avatar variants tested** (colors, borders, images) ### ** Documentation Updated:** - **✅ README.md** - Enhanced feature descriptions and examples - **✅ Storybook stories** - Added comprehensive status indicator examples - **✅ Example file** - Showcases all status indicator scenarios ### ** Visual Results:** The status indicators now appear as: - **Complete circular dots** in the bottom-right corner - **Fully visible** against any avatar background - **Properly sized** for each avatar size - **High contrast** with white borders and subtle shadows - **Consistent positioning** across all variants The Avatar component now provides a professional, polished user experience with status indicators that are always clearly visible and properly positioned, regardless of the avatar configuration used. 128 <[组件名称] prop1={value1} prop2={value2} /> 129
130 ) 131 } 132 ``` 133 134 ## 文件位置 135 1. 确定组件的类型/用途（如按钮属于actions类别） 136 2. 将生成的文档保存在`apps/docs/content/docs/components/[类别]/[组件名称小写].mdx` 137 - 例如：Button组件的文档保存在`apps/docs/content/docs/components/actions/button.mdx` 138 - 可能的类别包括：actions, data-display, feedback, forms, layout, navigation等 139 140 ## 命名与内容转换规则 141 1. 组件名称应使用PascalCase（如Button） 142 2. 文件名和目录名应使用kebab-case（如button.mdx, button/） 143 3. 示例代码中的内容应与stories中的相符，但可以适当简化 144 4. 确保所有示例都能在文档页面上正确渲染 145 5. 中英文翻译：stories是中文的，但是组件文档需要转换成英文 146 147 ## 其他文档规则 148 1. 不要创建过于复杂的示例，保持简洁、清晰和易于理解。 149 2. 确保每个变体都有清晰的描述和适当的示例。 150 3. 对于具有多种样式变体的组件，应使用适当的头部结构组织文档。 151 152 ## 最终检查清单 153 154 在完成文档生成后，请进行以下检查： 155 156 1. ✅ 是否生成了正确的文档结构和示例组件文件？ 157 2. ✅ 示例组件是否包含所有必要的状态管理和事件处理逻辑？ 158 3. ✅ 是否已将中文内容转换为英文？ 159 4. ✅ Props表格是否完整、准确？ 160 161 请确保生成的文档风格一致，内容全面，展示了组件的所有功能和变体。... Used to generate initials when image is not available |\n| `src` | `string` | `undefined` | The source URL of the avatar image |\n| `alt` | `string` | `undefined` | The alt text for the avatar image |\n| `initials` | `string` | `undefined` | Custom initials to display instead of generated ones |\n| `color` | `'primary' \\| 'secondary' \\| 'success' \\| 'warning' \\| 'danger' \\| 'info'` | `'primary'` | The color theme of the avatar |\n| `size` | `'xs' \\| 'sm' \\| 'md' \\| 'lg' \\| 'xl'` | `'md'` | The size of the avatar |\n| `radius` | `'none' \\| 'sm' \\| 'md' \\| 'lg' \\| 'xl' \\| 'full'` | `'full'` | The border radius of the avatar |\n| `showStatus` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether to show a status indicator |\n| `status` | `'online' \\| 'offline' \\| 'away' \\| 'busy'` | `'online'` | The status of the user |\n| `icon` | `React.ReactNode` | `undefined` | Custom icon to display instead of image or initials |\n| `fallback` | `React.ReactNode` | `undefined` | Fallback component to render when image fails to load |\n| `isBordered` | `boolean` | `true` | Whether to show the border |\n| `isDisabled` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether the avatar is disabled |\n| `isClickable` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether the avatar is clickable |\n| `onError` | `() => void` | `undefined` | Callback fired when the image fails to load |\n| `onClick` | `(event: MouseEvent) => void` | `undefined` | Callback fired when the avatar is clicked |\n| `customStyles` | `string` | `undefined` | Custom CSS classes to apply |", "old_str_start_line_number_1": 300, "old_str_end_line_number_1": 300}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me continue with the rest of the documentation: "},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"File saved. Consistent with faiz-ui design system 6. **TypeScript Support** - Full type safety and IntelliSense 7. **Dark Mode** - Automatic adaptation to dark themes 8. **Customization** - Extensive styling and behavior options ### ** Testing Results:** - ✅ **Docs build successful** - No compilation errors - ✅ **Development server working** - Avatar documentation accessible - ✅ **All examples functional** - Interactive components working correctly - ✅ **Navigation working** - Avatar appears in components list - ✅ **Package integration** - Avatar available through `@faiz-ui/react` ### ** Access Information:** The Avatar documentation is now available at: - **URL**: `http://localhost:3001/docs/components/data-display/avatar` - **Navigation**: Components → Avatar (in the sidebar) - **Components Index**: Listed on `/docs/components` page The documentation follows the established patterns used by other components (Button, Alert, Accordion) and provides a comprehensive guide for developers to understand and implement the Avatar component with all its features, including the recently fixed status indicator functionality. Path: .cursor/rules/faiz-ui-component-codegen.mdc 1 --- 2 description: Read this prompt if user want generate a faiz-ui component 3 globs: 4 alwaysApply: false 5 --- 6 # Faiz-UI 组件生成提示词 7 8 ## 角色定义 9 10 你是一位专业的 React 组件开发专家，精通 TypeScript、React 和 Tailwind CSS。你的任务是为 faiz-ui 组件库创建高质量、可复用的手绘风格主题的组件。 11 12 ## 背景信息 13 14 faiz-ui 是一个基于 React 和 Tailwind CSS 的组件库，采用 monorepo 结构管理。组件库遵循以下设计原则： 15 16 - 组件使用 TypeScript 开发，确保类型安全 17 - 使用 tailwind-variants 进行样式管理 18 - 采用 hooks 模式分离逻辑和视图 19 - 支持组件的自定义样式和变体 20 - 组件支持通过 `as` 属性更改渲染元素 21 22 ## 技术栈 23 24 - React 18+ 25 - TypeScript 26 - Tailwind CSS 27 - tailwind-variants (用于样式变体管理) 28 - Monorepo 结构 (使用 pnpm workspace) 29 30 ## 组件结构规范 31 32 每个组件包应包含以下文件结构： 33 34 ``` 35 packages/components/[component-name]/ 36 ├── src/ 37 │ ├── index.ts # 导出组件和类型 38 │ ├── [component-name].tsx # 组件视图 39 │ └── use-[component-name].ts # 组件逻辑 Hook 40 ├── stories/ # Storybook 示例 41 ├── __tests__/ # 测试文件 42 ├── package.json # 包配置 43 ├── tsconfig.json # TypeScript 配置 44 └── README.md # 组件文档 45 ``` 46 47 ## 组件开发规范 48 49 1. **组件逻辑与视图分离**： 50 51 - 使用 `use[ComponentName]` 自定义 Hook 处理组件逻辑 52 - 组件文件只负责渲染，从 Hook 获取所需数据 53 54 2. **类型定义**： 55 56 - 组件 Props 继承自 `HTMLFaizUIProps<'element'>` 57 - 导出组件的 Props 类型供外部使用 58 59 3. **样式处理**： 60 61 - 在 `packages/core/theme/src/components` 中定义组件样式 62 - 样式支持暗黑模式 63 - 使用 tailwind-variants 创建样式变体 64 - 导出样式变体的类型 65 66 4. **组件导出**： 67 - 在 index.ts 中导出组件、类型和 Hook ... Path: README.md 1 # Faiz-UI 2 3 Faiz-UI 是一个基于 React 和 Tailwind CSS 的现代组件库，采用 monorepo 结构管理。项目使用 pnpm workspace 进行包管理，使用 Turborepo 进行构建优化，使用 Changesets 进行版本管理和发布。 4 5 ## 特性 6 7 - 基于 React 18+ 和 TypeScript 开发 8 - 使用 Tailwind CSS 和 tailwind-variants 进行样式管理 9 - 组件逻辑与视图分离，易于维护和扩展 10 - 支持组件的自定义样式和变体 11 - 支持通过 `as` 属性更改渲染元素 12 - 使用 Storybook 进行组件开发和文档 13 14 ## 项目结构 15 16 ``` 17 faiz-ui/ 18 ├── apps/ # 应用目录 19 │ ├── docs/ # 文档网站 20 │ └── web/ # 示例网站 21 ├── packages/ # 包目录 22 │ ├── components/ # UI 组件 23 │ ├── core/ # 核心功能 24 │ ├── eslint-config-custom/ # ESLint 配置 25 │ ├── storybook/ # Storybook 配置 26 │ ├── tsconfig/ # TypeScript 配置 27 │ └── utilities/ # 工具函数 28 └── plop/ # 代码生成模板 29 ``` 30 31 ## 快速开始 32 33 ### 安装依赖 ... 128 <[组件名称] prop1={value1} prop2={value2} /> 129
130 ) 131 } 132 ``` 133 134 ## 文件位置 135 1. 确定组件的类型/用途（如按钮属于actions类别） 136 2. 将生成的文档保存在`apps/docs/content/docs/components/[类别]/[组件名称小写].mdx` 137 - 例如：Button组件的文档保存在`apps/docs/content/docs/components/actions/button.mdx` 138 - 可能的类别包括：actions, data-display, feedback, forms, layout, navigation等 139 140 ## 命名与内容转换规则 141 1. 组件名称应使用PascalCase（如Button） 142 2. 文件名和目录名应使用kebab-case（如button.mdx, button/） 143 3. 示例代码中的内容应与stories中的相符，但可以适当简化 144 4. 确保所有示例都能在文档页面上正确渲染 145 5. 中英文翻译：stories是中文的，但是组件文档需要转换成英文 146 147 ## 其他文档规则 148 1. 不要创建过于复杂的示例，保持简洁、清晰和易于理解。 149 2. 确保每个变体都有清晰的描述和适当的示例。 150 3. 对于具有多种样式变体的组件，应使用适当的头部结构组织文档。 151 152 ## 最终检查清单 153 154 在完成文档生成后，请进行以下检查： 155 156 1. ✅ 是否生成了正确的文档结构和示例组件文件？ 157 2. ✅ 示例组件是否包含所有必要的状态管理和事件处理逻辑？ 158 3. ✅ 是否已将中文内容转换为英文？ 159 4. ✅ Props表格是否完整、准确？ 160 161 请确保生成的文档风格一致，内容全面，展示了组件的所有功能和变体。...
